abstract: Turkey, once one of Syria's closest allies, is providing shelter to Free Syrian Army, opposition group waging an insurgency against government of Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad, and allowing them to orchestrate attacks across the border; Turkey is expected to impose sanctions on Syria but its harboring of opposition leaders, militia composed of defectors from Syrian armed forces, may be its most striking challenge to Syria yet.
snippet: Once one of Syria’s closest allies, Turkey is hosting an armed opposition group waging an insurgency against the government of President Bashar al-Assad.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )

lead_paragraph: Once one of Syria’s closest allies, Turkey is hosting an armed opposition group waging an insurgency against the government of President Bashar al-Assad.

headline.main: In Slap at Syria, Turkey Shelters Anti-Assad Fighters
headline.print_headline: In Slap At Syria, Turkey Shelters Anti-Assad Force
headline.seo: Turkey Shelters Anti-Assad Group, the Free Syrian Army
